item.description:

item.title: By: Dustin Diaz
item.dc:creator: Dustin Diaz
item.description: Geoffrey, that's a fun test and all :) But basically the point was that we can actively and confidently use [!doctype html]
item.content:encoded: Geoffrey, that’s a fun test and all ðŸ™‚ But basically the point was that we can actively and confidently use [!doctype html]

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/12/02/minimum-html-5-document/#comment-2547">Geoffrey Sneddon</a>.
Nice catch, that does pass as valid HTML5. That might be a little too minimal though :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Geoffrey Sneddon.

Nice catch, that does pass as valid HTML5. That might be a little too minimal though ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Geoffrey Sneddon
item.dc:creator: Geoffrey Sneddon
item.description:
That's untrue: the html, head, and body elements all have optional start and end tags. The shortest valid document is:
<code><doctype html><title></title></code>
item.content:encoded:
That’s untrue: the html, head, and body elements all have optional start and end tags. The shortest valid document is:

<doctype html><title></title>
